questions.question_text_1: A machine client M makes multiple requests to three different servers A, B and C in the order A then B followed by C. However, it can make a request to server B only after receiving the response from server A and same with server C i.e. the client can make a request to server C only after receiving response from server B. If the servers A, B and C are located at 900 kms, 1200 kms and 1500 kms respectively, answer the given subquestions.[Consider speed of light in air to be 3 x 108 m/s]
question_texts: A machine client M makes multiple requests to three different servers A, B and C in the order A then B followed by C. However, it can make a request to server B only after receiving the response from server A and same with server C i.e. the client can make a request to server C only after receiving response from server B. If the servers A, B and C are located at 900 kms, 1200 kms and 1500 kms respectively, answer the given subquestions.[Consider speed of light in air to be 3 x 108 m/s]

props.summary:
Here’s a structured **summary of core topics, concepts, principles, and equations** for the **"Modern Application Development I"** exam, followed by **Mermaid knowledge graphs** to visualize relationships. --- ## **Core Topics & Concepts Summary** ### **1. Web Fundamentals** #### **URL Structure** - **Components**: - **Protocol** (`https`, `http`): Communication rules. - **Domain** (`seek.study.iitm.ac.in`): Server address. - **Subdomain** (`seek`): Part of the domain hierarchy. - **Path** (`/courses/ns_23t3_cs2003`): Resource location. - **Query Parameters** (`?type=lesson&tab=course`): Key-value pairs for dynamic content. - **Fragment** (`#section`): Client-side navigation (not in the given URL). - **Key Equation**: - **Hexadecimal Conversion** (e.g., IPv4 `171.216.21.100` → `AB.D8.15.64`): - Break each octet into hex pairs. #### **HTTP/HTTPS** - **Status Codes**: - `200 OK`: Success. - `400 Bad Request`: Client error. - `401 Unauthorized`: Authentication failed. - `404 Not Found`: Resource missing. - `500 Internal Server Error`: Server failure. - **Headers**: - `Content-Type`: MIME type (e.g., `text/html`). - `Content-Length`: Size of the response body. - **MIME Types**: - `text/html`, `application/json`, `image/png`. #### **Networking Basics** - **Round-Trip Time (RTT)**: - Time for a request to travel to a server and back. - **Equation**: \[ RTT = \frac{2 \times \text{Distance}}{\text{Speed of Light}} \quad (\text{Speed of light} = 3 \times 10^8 \, \text{m/s}) \] - Example: For **Server C (1500 km)**: \[ RTT = \frac{2 \times 1500 \times 10^3}{3 \times 10^8} = 0.01 \, \text{seconds} = 10 \, \text{ms} \] - **Maximum Requests per Second**: - **Equation**: \[ \text{Requests/sec} = \frac{1}{RTT} \] - Example: For **Server A (900 km)**: \[ RTT = \frac{2 \times 900 \times 10^3}{3 \times 10^8} = 6 \, \text{ms} \implies \text{Requests/sec} = \frac{1}{0.006} \approx 166 \] (But the correct answer in the paper is **42**, likely due to additional processing time.) --- ### **2. HTML/CSS** #### **HTML Rendering** - **Block vs. Inline Elements**: - `div`: Block-level (takes full width). - `span`: Inline (flows with text) unless `display: block` is applied. - **CSS Specificity**: - **Order of Priority**: `!important` > Inline Styles > IDs > Classes/Attributes > Elements. - Example: ```html

Text

``` - **Inline (`red`)** > **ID (`green`)** > **Class (`blue`)**. #### **CSS Selectors** - **Pseudo-classes**: - `:valid`/`invalid`: Applied to form inputs based on validation rules (e.g., `minlength`). - Example: ```css input:valid { background: green; } input:invalid { background: red; } ``` #### **Box Model** - **Properties**: - `width`, `margin`, `border`, `padding`. - Example: ```css div { width: 8%; margin: 2px; border: 1px solid black; } ``` --- ### **3. JavaScript & Frontend Frameworks** #### **Web Components** - **Core Technologies**: - **Custom Elements**: Define new HTML tags. - **Shadow DOM**: Encapsulated DOM/subtree. - **HTML Templates**: Reusable markup (`
